title: The Walking Dead’s Danai Gurira reveals what happened on ‘overwhelming’ last day
text:
Danai Gurira has opened up about her last day on The Walking Dead (Picture: AMC)

Danai Gurira has recalled what happened on her final days filming on The Walking Dead, and it sounds like a perfect send-off.

The show’s tenth season represents the last for Danai Gurira’s Michonne, who joined the show way back in 2012 in the third season.

Following the season 10 premiere, Danai has opened up about her final days on set in July, where Norman Reedus organised a special farewell involving fireworks and cake.

Speaking to ComicBook.com, Danai said: ‘It was actually the night before I was finishing. I was finishing on the fourth of July so I didn’t think anyone was going to be around. So they caught me the night before and I was totally off guard.

‘Everyone was gathered, there was this gorgeous cake that was Michonne with the sword and everything… Norman [Reedus] and, of course, Darrell Pritchett, the amazing man in charge of our special effects, they had this massive, really gorgeous, overwhelming fireworks display.’

The big question now is how Michonne’s exit will pan out on the show, and whether she could potentially return for the planned Rick Grimes movies.

Danai Gurira at New York Comic Con (Picture: Ilya S. Savenok/Getty Images for ReedPOP )

Avi Nash, who plays Siddiq, recently teased what to expect to Metro.co.uk, saying: ‘I think the writers and Angela [Kang] particularly have done a really good job of crafting her exit in a way that pays tribute to her character and pays tribute to the legacy of her work.

‘Even though we knew it was coming and it was sad for it to happen, it’s been done in a really lovely way.’

The Walking Dead recently announced Maggie (Lauren Cohan) will return later in season 10, after disappearing from the show midway through the ninth season.

The Walking Dead season 10 continues on Sunday in the US, and on Monday in the UK on Fox.
